snippet: After four years of very slow growth, the spending increase is linked to expanded coverage through the Affordable Care Act and to improvements in the economy.
abstract: Government experts predict rebound in national health care spending as expansions in coverage and improvements in the economy take hold after four years of exceptionally slow growth; link increase to expanded coverage under the Affordable Care Act, faster economic growth, and an aging population.
lead_paragraph: After four years of very slow growth, the spending increase is linked to expanded coverage through the Affordable Care Act and to improvements in the economy.

headline.main: After Slow Growth, Experts Say, Health Spending Is Expected to Climb
headline.print_headline: After Slow Growth, Experts Say, Health Spending Is Expected to Climb
